text:
We are moving from LiveHelpNow (LHN), to HubSpot's livechat (and bot). LHN doesn't handle the events to send to Google Analytics so I created a dataLayer.push function to fire when the chat started (containing the event, category, action and label) on Google Tag Manager and subsequently linked this to the Google Analytics Goal "LiveChat". HubSpot Livechat makes my life easier because it is intuitive and doesn't make me want to gauge my eyes out when I log into it like LHN does. If the livechat initiates its own dataLayer.push then I can get rid of my code that I used for LHN and let HubSpot do its thing and simply create a new goal that will be assigned to HubSpot Live Chat.

Also, is there a sandbox of sorts I can create because at the moment, everytime I turn on the HubSpot livechat (even on our demo site), it activates on the live site too which means we have 2 chat boxes showing up.
thanks AJ
are "tags" the same as "topics"?
I'm trying to create a blog template that uses a different view for tag (category) listings than it uses for the default listings.
Hey Peter, yup, tags and topics are the same thing
If you don't add a filter it should just be left alone. I also see that you have a CSS `class="capital-case"` there that could be changing the formatting.
THANKS, AJ!
Topics are Categories.

<@UBUNBSM24> Hey! Filter is gone and the tag text is all lowercase, even though that is NOT how the tags actually are. Also, the class name you mentioned doesn't actually have any styling connected to it. Removing it makes no difference. So I have this:

`<h1>Filtered by Topic: <span class="">'{{tag|replace('-', ' ') }}'</span></h1>`

Tags display all lowercase. Browser inspector shows nothing in play here for text transforming type elements.

Hey <@UDEASNWEB> currently there is no native push notifications that HubSpot has. Can you post this to the ideas forum and then post back a link to it in the <#C26E7JT8V|ideas> channel? Also, I have used OneSignal (not on a production environment, more for just playing around) and I found it to be pretty easy to use.
You may be able to use Zapier and use this: <https://zapier.com/app-directory/onesignal/integrations/rss/8120/send-onesignal-push-notifications-for-new-rss-items>
Perfect, will do. Thanks for looking into it.
No Problem, if I hear any updates on this, I will def make sure to keep you posted :slightly_smiling_face:
Thanks

Hi everyone, I'm trying to cutomize the HubSpot meeting iframe css, does anybody know how can I do that ? Searching for an answer on stackoverflow, it seems that it's hardly doable when the iframe has different domain than the website. I hope somebody here has faced the same issue and found an solution ! Thanks
You can not. You can not access the inside of an iframe unless it comes from your own domain.
That is a browser security feature

Sorry, I'm a little low on sleep today :slightly_smiling_face: I believe that "tag" there is pulling in the tag slug, which is why it's replacing the - (for my-topic) with a space. Those will always be lower case. If this is on the topic page, it's actually a bit of a pain to get the topic name for that page. In the documentation they have you pull the page's title (which combines the page title in your Blog Settings and the tag, something like "My Awesome Blog | My Topic") and remove the first part ("My Awesome Blog | ") - like `<h1>Filtered by Topic: '{{ page_meta.html_title|replace(' | ', '') }}'</h1>`: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/blog-content-markup#if-topic-statement>

<@UBUNBSM24> Thank you so much! I wasn't thinking of it coming from the HTML title either. Your comment put me on the right track and I was able to edit as needed and get exactly the desired result. Thanks!
Awesome! Glad I could help :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey all - looking for recommendations on building a login system for a HubSpot COS. I'm building a website for a client on HubSpot COS and they want me to create a "members only" section" of the site where users can log in to access "gated" content.  Is this doable with HubDB? Perhaps somehow integrating Firebase with HubSpot? I've read about someone simulating a login system using Smart Content but that feels a lil dirty. Open to all ides here - thanks!

Hey David, this is available if they are on Marketing Enterprise:
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cms-pages-editor/control-audience-access-to-pages>

As we have a Membership feature

i am searching for such a solution as well, without the need for Enterprise though…the client said they won´t pay as much and they also would not benefit from most of the added features because it´s about the login. I was told that there is a way to do it with HubDB but i is “hacky” and can be hacked so it would not be able to protect valuable information.
Thanks <@U2H3TT8F2> I'll see if they're open to paying to Enterprise and will look into the link you've provided.

<@UBT0AHWLD> if my client doesnt pay for Enterprise I'm gonna research hooking up Firebase to HubSpot - I have extensive knowledge of both systems and feel like it's doable - will share my post research notes with you.
that would be awesome!! i might have two projects coming up that would benefit from this!
Did something change with blog publishing?
Normally, when I update the content in a blog post, the publish date stays the same, but in the past week or so, I’ve noticed that updating changes the publish date
Hey Ian, can you DM me some posts where this happens? I can loop in on our end and see whats up
Hey AJ.  I’ve ended up backdating everything
Let me get back to you tomorrow.  Another team member flagged this to me and I ended up fixing stuff.  I’ll see if I can replicate tomorrow.
:+1:  is it just when you updated content on the blog post or was there other steps taken?
It was just a simple content edit I believe
I actually had it happen to me previously when I had unlinked an inline hyperlink
I am not able to recreate on a test portal I have, so keep me posted for sure
Sounds good.  Thanks for getting in touch so fast.  Unfortunately I’m just running out the door for a reservation
All good
no worries, we’ll loop in tomorrow
